page.title: 12LEISURE AND RECREATION
page.content: Children play in their own gardens in the fields or in the Royal Forest of Dean.Most men and women are keen gardeners of flowers,fruit and vegetables.There are 3 Public Houses with League games of Darts,Crib and Dominoes.The Caves of Wigpool attract many cavers.Many ex-miners are keen Pigeon Fanciers.There are sports clubs in neigbouring villages to which some of the young people belong.There is Horse riding at the Lea Bailey.Some youngsters are interested in Motor Track Racing which they practice in the woods.The Lea Parish Room is the base for the Brownies,Mothers Union, W.I.,Rainbow Club,Art Club,Toddlers Group and Play Group.Some people are members of local Drybrook Silver Band and a Men's Choir or the Ladies Choral Society.There is the Linton Historical Society which interests some residents
